title: Remove original matplotlib based display, main program 'teepeesee' and rename 'cueteepeesee' main program entry 'qtpc'
Factor cueteepeesee from single file program to modules
description: The cueteepeesee is currently a single file python program and is getting long.  It should have its classes and functions factored into modules under the teepeesee parent module according to concepts of file I/O, top-level fixed GUI elements (menus, toolbars) and display GUI elements.

title: AttributeError: 'RandomDataSource' object has no attribute 'setLayer'
description: Added setLayer() method to RandomDataSource class to match the API of TensorFileSource. The method updates the _layer property and regenerates the data when the layer changes, maintaining consistency with other data sources.

title: Auto reload data when it changes.
description: Using inotify feature or simple polling of loaded files, react to a change in the content by reloading the new data into the current display without changing any display state.  For example, if currently viewing index=2, the reload should start at index=2 and if the displays are zoomed, they should stay zoomed.

title: Allow for comparisons of different data TIERs for the same index
description: The input data arrays originate from a computational graph.  Different arrays may be extracted from different nodes in the graph.  The stream of arrays from each computation graph node are generally synchronized such that index=0 from node A and index=0 from node B represent the same unerlying 'event' but with the information processed in different ways.  We call these different representations 'DATA TIERS' or just 'tiers'.  To debug nodes and understand the underlying information we want to plot different tiers in ways that can be combined or compared.  We already have the start of this in the case that one array has a 3rd dimension and we may select which 'layer' to display.  We want to extend this initial idea in many ways.

title: Support multiple synchronized file streams
description: Extended the implementation with source selection capabilities. Changes: (1) Added 'name' argument (default None) to all source constructors (DataSource, RandomDataSource, FileSource, FrameFileSource, TensorFileSource). (2) Updated .name properties to return custom name if provided, otherwise fall back to first filename or generated name. (3) Added sourceAdded signal to SourceManager that emits source object when add_source() succeeds. (4) Added sourceSelected signal to SourceManager. (5) Added select_source(name) method to SourceManager that sets _current_source and emits sourceSelected. (6) Modified _aggregate_and_emit to only emit data from _current_source when one is selected. (7) Added source dropdown (QComboBox) to MainWindow toolbar. (8) Connected sourceAdded to on_source_added which populates dropdown. (9) Connected dropdown selection to on_source_combo_changed which calls select_source(). (10) Connected sourceSelected to on_source_selected to update dropdown display. All syntax checks pass.

comments.author: Brett Viren
comments.text:
Complete implementation summary:

## Phase 1: Core SourceManager Implementation
- Created SourceManager class in sources/base.py to manage multiple synchronized data sources
- Added index parameter (default 0) to all source constructors: DataSource, RandomDataSource, FileSource, FrameFileSource, TensorFileSource
- Replaced MainWindow.current_source with MainWindow.source_manager
- Replaced _connect_source() with _connect_source_manager() that connects SourceManager methods/signals to UI
- Updated load_file_source() and init_random_source() to add sources to manager instead of replacing
- SourceManager synchronizes index/layer across all sources, caches data from each source, provides prev/next/jump/setLayer methods
- Added indexChanged signal to SourceManager, connected to on_index_changed slot in MainWindow

## Phase 2: Source Selection Features
- Added name parameter (default None) to all source constructors
- Updated .name properties: returns custom name if provided, otherwise first filename or generated name
- Added sourceAdded signal (emits source object when add_source() succeeds)
- Added sourceSelected signal (emits when source is selected)
- Added select_source(name) method to SourceManager: sets _current_source, emits sourceSelected, re-emits data
- Modified _aggregate_and_emit() to emit only current source's data when one is selected
- Added source dropdown (QComboBox) to MainWindow toolbar
- Connected sourceAdded → on_source_added() to populate dropdown
- Connected dropdown selection → on_source_combo_changed() → select_source()
- Connected sourceSelected → on_source_selected() to update dropdown display

## Phase 3: Enhanced Navigation & Initial Files
- Added PgUp/PgDn keyboard shortcuts to cycle through sources (prev_source/next_source methods)
- Implemented _load_initial_files() to parse colon-delimited syntax: 'name:filename' groups files by name, plain filenames loaded individually
- Updated load_file_source() to accept optional name parameter, passes to FileSource constructor
- FileSource/FrameFileSource/TensorFileSource now pass name through delegation chain

## Phase 4: Display Clearing Bug Fix
- Added clear() method to FrameDisplay: resets data to None, calls clear() on image/time/channel widgets
- Updated distribute_data() to clear displays beyond data length, preventing display of stale data from previous source
- When switching sources, displays without corresponding parts now show blank instead of previous source data

All syntax checks pass. System supports multiple synchronized file streams with named grouping and proper display management.

title: Show all current tiers as 1D plots in the time and channel slice plots using current crosshairs.

comments.author: Brett Viren
comments.text: This should add a colormap named  "RGB Multi" which will show up to 3 sources of data on the 2D image, each providing either red, blue or grean.  Normalize the pixel value of each source to 1 to determine the fraction of primary color that pixel provides.  In the 1D plots, plots all source data using graphs of the corresponding primary color.  If there is only on source, use just Red, if only two use Red and Green.  If more than three sources, use only three.

comments.author: Brett Viren
comments.text:
Complete implementation of RGB Multi colormap for multi-source tier visualization:

## Phase 1: Multi-curve 1D Plot Support (displays.py)
- Modified FrameTime and FrameChan classes to support multiple curves
- Changed from single curve attribute to curves list
- Added update_multi_trace() methods that accept list of data slices
- Uses R, G, B colors for up to 3 sources (single source uses Red only, two sources use Red+Green)
- Added clear() methods to properly clean up plot items

## Phase 2: FrameDisplay Multi-Source Support (displays.py)
- Added multi_source_data and multi_baseline_data lists to store data from multiple sources
- Added _rgb_multi_mode flag to track RGB Multi mode state
- Added set_rgb_multi_mode() method to enable/disable RGB mode
- Added updateMultiData() method to update with data from multiple sources (max 3)
- Created _create_rgb_composite() method:
  * Normalizes each source's data to [0, 1] range
  * Assigns sources to RGB channels (1 source=Red, 2=Red+Green, 3=RGB)
  * Returns (height, width, 3) RGB composite image
- Modified _apply_current_state() to handle RGB mode vs normal mode
- Modified _on_internal_change() to extract slices from individual sources in RGB mode
- Calls update_multi_trace() for time and channel plots with all source slices

## Phase 3: Menu and UI Integration (gui.py)
- Added 'RGB Multi' to colormap menu with shortcut 'C, M'
- Modified set_cmap() to handle rgb_multi mode:
  * Enables RGB Multi mode on all displays
  * Calls _redistribute_for_rgb_multi() to update with multi-source data
  * For normal colormaps, disables RGB mode and calls _redistribute_normal()
- Added _redistribute_for_rgb_multi():
  * Gets data from all sources via source_manager.get_all_sources_data()
  * Groups data by part index across sources
  * Calls updateMultiData() on each display with corresponding part data from all sources
- Added _redistribute_normal():
  * Gets data from current source only
  * Updates displays with single-source data
- Modified distribute_data() to check for RGB Multi mode and route appropriately

## Phase 4: SourceManager Data Access (sources/base.py)
- Added get_all_sources_data() method:
  * Returns list of lists (each inner list is parts from one source)
  * Uses _cached_data to access all sources' data
- Added get_current_source_data() method:
  * Returns parts from _current_source only
  * Used for normal single-source display mode

## Result
- Users can select 'RGB Multi' colormap to overlay up to 3 data sources as RGB channels on 2D image
- Pixel intensity for each channel determined by normalized source value
- 1D time and channel plots show all sources with corresponding colors (R, G, B)
- Crosshairs update all 1D plots showing current row/column from all sources
- Single source uses Red, two sources use Red+Green, three+ use full RGB

All syntax checks pass.

title: Show up to three tier arrays simultaneously in the 2D display by mapping each of their pixel sample values to a separate Red Green or Blue color.
description: This requires each array to be normalized to have pixel values in the range [0.0, 1.0].

comments.author: Brett Viren
comments.text: This got described as part of tpc-sxn.2 and fixed there as well.

title: Show differences in tier arrays for a common index in the 2D display by making a 'flicker' or 'flip' feature.
description: The idea is to load the arrays in off-screen images that have their pixels ranges kept in sync and then have the ability to quickly load one array or another. For example, hitting a keyboard shortcut would cycle through the different tier arrays.
close_reason: This is not needed as cycling between selected sources is fast enough

title: The initial X-axis range on the displays should be set based on the size of the array.
description: Fixed the initial X-axis range by setting a reasonable default range (0, 1000) for both axes in FrameImage.__init__() instead of relying on pyqtgraph's default range of -1 to 1. This initial range is properly overridden by reset_to_default_view() once actual data is loaded with the correct array dimensions.

title: Use QtPy wrapper instead of directly using PyQt6
description: Converted codebase from PyQt6 to QtPy wrapper for Qt binding compatibility. Changes: (1) Updated pyproject.toml to add qtpy>=2.4.0 dependency while keeping pyqt6 as backend; (2) Changed imports in cueteepeesee.py from 'import PyQt6.QtWidgets as qw' to 'from qtpy import QtWidgets as qw' (same for QtCore and QtGui); (3) Updated CLAUDE.md documentation to reflect QtPy usage and note Qt backend flexibility. The pyqtSignal and pyqtSlot decorators continue to work as QtPy maintains PyQt API compatibility.
